name: _complete
description: Internal command to provide shell completion suggestions

options.name: shell
options.description: The shell type ("bash", "fish", "zsh")

options.name: input
options.description: An array of input tokens (e.g. COMP_WORDS or argv)

options.name: current
options.description: The index of the "input" array that the cursor is in (e.g. COMP_CWORD)

options.name: api-version
options.description: The API version of the completion script

options.name: symfony
options.description: deprecated

name: about
description: Display basic information about your application

options.name: only
options.description: The section to display

options.name: json
options.description: Output the information as JSON

name: auth:clear-resets
description: Flush expired password reset tokens

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the password broker

name: breeze:install
description: Install the Breeze controllers and resources

arguments.name: stack
arguments.description: The development stack that should be installed (blade,livewire,livewire-functional,react,vue,api)

options.name: dark
options.description: Indicate that dark mode support should be installed

options.name: pest
options.description: Indicate that Pest should be installed

options.name: ssr
options.description: Indicates if Inertia SSR support should be installed

options.name: typescript
options.description: Indicates if TypeScript is preferred for the Inertia stack

options.name: eslint
options.description: Indicates if ESLint with Prettier should be installed

options.name: composer
options.description: Absolute path to the Composer binary which should be used to install packages

name: cache:clear
description: Flush the application cache

arguments.name: store
arguments.description: The name of the store you would like to clear

options.name: tags
options.description: The cache tags you would like to clear

name: cache:forget
description: Remove an item from the cache

arguments.name: store
arguments.description: The store to remove the key from

name: cache:prune-stale-tags
description: Prune stale cache tags from the cache (Redis only)

arguments.name: store
arguments.description: The name of the store you would like to prune tags from

name: cashier:webhook
description: Create the Stripe webhook to interact with Cashier

options.name: disabled
options.description: Immediately disable the webhook after creation

options.name: url
options.description: The URL endpoint for the webhook

options.name: api-version
options.description: The Stripe API version the webhook should use

name: channel:list
description: List all registered private broadcast channels

name: clear-compiled
description: Remove the compiled class file

name: completion
description: Dump the shell completion script

arguments.name: shell
arguments.description: The shell type (e.g. "bash"), the value of the "$SHELL" env var will be used if this is not given

options.name: debug
options.description: Tail the completion debug log

name: config:cache
description: Create a cache file for faster configuration loading

name: config:clear
description: Remove the configuration cache file

description: Publish configuration files to your application

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the configuration file to publish

options.name: all
options.description: Publish all configuration files

options.name: force
options.description: Overwrite any existing configuration files

description: Display all of the values for a given configuration file or key

arguments.name: config
arguments.description: The configuration file or key to show

description: Start a new database CLI session

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: The database connection that should be used

options.name: read
options.description: Connect to the read connection

options.name: write
options.description: Connect to the write connection

description: Monitor the number of connections on the specified database

options.name: databases
options.description: The database connections to monitor

options.name: max
options.description: The maximum number of connections that can be open before an event is dispatched

arguments.description: The class name of the root seeder

options.description: The class name of the root seeder

options.name: database
options.description: The database connection to seed

options.name: force
options.description: Force the operation to run when in production

name: db:show
description: Display information about the given database

options.name: database
options.description: The database connection

options.name: json
options.description: Output the database information as JSON

options.name: counts
options.description: Show the table row count <bg=red;options=bold> Note: This can be slow on large databases </>

options.name: views
options.description: Show the database views <bg=red;options=bold> Note: This can be slow on large databases </>

options.name: types
options.description: Show the user defined types

name: db:table
description: Display information about the given database table

options.name: database
options.description: The database connection

options.name: json
options.description: Output the table information as JSON

name: db:wipe
description: Drop all tables, views, and types

options.name: database
options.description: The database connection to use

options.name: drop-views
options.description: Drop all tables and views

options.name: drop-types
options.description: Drop all tables and types (Postgres only)

options.name: force
options.description: Force the operation to run when in production

name: docs
description: Access the Laravel documentation

arguments.name: section
arguments.description: The section of the page to open

name: down
description: Put the application into maintenance / demo mode

options.name: redirect
options.description: The path that users should be redirected to

options.name: render
options.description: The view that should be prerendered for display during maintenance mode

options.name: retry
options.description: The number of seconds after which the request may be retried

options.name: refresh
options.description: The number of seconds after which the browser may refresh

options.name: secret
options.description: The secret phrase that may be used to bypass maintenance mode

options.name: with-secret
options.description: Generate a random secret phrase that may be used to bypass maintenance mode

options.name: status
options.description: The status code that should be used when returning the maintenance mode response

name: horizon
description: Start a master supervisor in the foreground

options.name: environment
options.description: The environment name

name: horizon:clear
description: Delete all of the jobs from the specified queue

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: The name of the queue connection

options.name: queue
options.description: The name of the queue to clear

options.name: force
options.description: Force the operation to run when in production

name: horizon:clear-metrics
description: Delete metrics for all jobs and queues

name: horizon:continue
description: Instruct the master supervisor to continue processing jobs

name: horizon:continue-supervisor
description: Instruct the supervisor to continue processing jobs

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the supervisor to resume

name: horizon:forget
description: Delete a failed queue job

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The ID of the failed job

options.name: all
options.description: Delete all failed jobs

name: horizon:install
description: Install all of the Horizon resources

name: horizon:list
description: List all of the deployed machines

name: horizon:pause
description: Pause the master supervisor

name: horizon:pause-supervisor
description: Pause a supervisor

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the supervisor to pause

name: horizon:publish
description: Publish all of the Horizon resources

name: horizon:purge
description: Terminate any rogue Horizon processes

options.name: signal
options.description: The signal to send to the rogue processes

name: horizon:snapshot
description: Store a snapshot of the queue metrics

name: horizon:status
description: Get the current status of Horizon

name: horizon:supervisor
description: Start a new supervisor

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: The name of the connection to work

options.name: balance
options.description: The balancing strategy the supervisor should apply

options.name: delay
options.description: The number of seconds to delay failed jobs (Deprecated)

options.name: backoff
options.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying a job that encountered an uncaught exception

options.name: max-jobs
options.description: The number of jobs to process before stopping a child process

options.name: max-time
options.description: The maximum number of seconds a child process should run

options.name: force
options.description: Force the worker to run even in maintenance mode

options.name: max-processes
options.description: The maximum number of total workers to start

options.name: min-processes
options.description: The minimum number of workers to assign per queue

options.name: memory
options.description: The memory limit in megabytes

options.name: nice
options.description: The process priority

options.name: paused
options.description: Start the supervisor in a paused state

options.name: queue
options.description: The names of the queues to work

options.name: sleep
options.description: Number of seconds to sleep when no job is available

options.name: timeout
options.description: The number of seconds a child process can run

options.name: tries
options.description: Number of times to attempt a job before logging it failed

options.name: auto-scaling-strategy
options.description: If supervisor should scale by jobs or time to complete

options.name: balance-cooldown
options.description: The number of seconds to wait in between auto-scaling attempts

options.name: balance-max-shift
options.description: The maximum number of processes to increase or decrease per one scaling

options.name: workers-name
options.description: The name that should be assigned to the workers

options.name: parent-id
options.description: The parent process ID

options.name: rest
options.description: Number of seconds to rest between jobs

name: horizon:supervisor-status
description: Show the status for a given supervisor

name: horizon:supervisors
description: List all of the supervisors

name: horizon:terminate
description: Terminate the master supervisor so it can be restarted

options.name: wait
options.description: Wait for all workers to terminate

name: horizon:timeout
description: Get the maximum timeout for the given environment

name: horizon:work
description: Start processing jobs on the queue as a daemon

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: The name of the queue connection to work

options.name: name
options.description: The name of the worker

options.name: delay
options.description: The number of seconds to delay failed jobs (Deprecated)

options.name: backoff
options.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying a job that encountered an uncaught exception

options.name: max-jobs
options.description: The number of jobs to process before stopping

options.name: max-time
options.description: The maximum number of seconds the worker should run

options.name: daemon
options.description: Run the worker in daemon mode (Deprecated)

options.name: force
options.description: Force the worker to run even in maintenance mode

options.name: memory
options.description: The memory limit in megabytes

options.name: once
options.description: Only process the next job on the queue

options.name: stop-when-empty
options.description: Stop when the queue is empty

options.name: queue
options.description: The names of the queues to work

options.name: sleep
options.description: Number of seconds to sleep when no job is available

options.name: rest
options.description: Number of seconds to rest between jobs

options.name: supervisor
options.description: The name of the supervisor the worker belongs to

options.name: timeout
options.description: The number of seconds a child process can run

options.name: tries
options.description: Number of times to attempt a job before logging it failed

options.name: json
options.description: Output the queue worker information as JSON

options.description: Use file system polling while watching in order to watch files over a network

options.name: force
options.description: Overwrite any existing files

name: telescope:resume
description: Unpause all Telescope watchers

name: test
description: Run the application tests

options.name: without-tty
options.description: Disable output to TTY

options.name: compact
options.description: Indicates whether the compact printer should be used

options.name: coverage
options.description: Indicates whether code coverage information should be collected

options.name: min
options.description: Indicates the minimum threshold enforcement for code coverage

options.name: parallel
options.description: Indicates if the tests should run in parallel

options.name: profile
options.description: Lists top 10 slowest tests

options.name: recreate-databases
options.description: Indicates if the test databases should be re-created

options.name: drop-databases
options.description: Indicates if the test databases should be dropped

options.name: without-databases
options.description: Indicates if database configuration should be performed

name: tinker
description: Interact with your application

options.name: execute
options.description: Execute the given code using Tinker

name: up
description: Bring the application out of maintenance mode

name: vapor:health-check
description: Check the health of the Vapor application

name: vapor:queue-failed
description: List all of the failed queue jobs

options.name: limit
options.description: The number of failed jobs to return

options.name: page
options.description: The page of failed jobs to return

options.name: id
options.description: The job ID filter by

options.name: queue
options.description: The queue to filter by

options.name: query
options.description: The search query to filter by

options.name: start
options.description: The start timestamp to filter by

name: vapor:schedule
description: Run the scheduled commands at the beginning of every minute

name: vapor:work
description: Process a Vapor job

options.name: delay
options.description: The number of seconds to delay failed jobs

options.name: timeout
options.description: The number of seconds a child process can run

options.name: tries
options.description: Number of times to attempt a job before logging it failed

options.name: force
options.description: Force the worker to run even in maintenance mode

name: vendor:publish
description: Publish any publishable assets from vendor packages

options.name: existing
options.description: Publish and overwrite only the files that have already been published

options.name: force
options.description: Overwrite any existing files

options.name: all
options.description: Publish assets for all service providers without prompt

options.name: provider
options.description: The service provider that has assets you want to publish

options.name: tag
options.description: One or many tags that have assets you want to publish

name: view:cache
description: Compile all of the application's Blade templates

name: view:clear
description: Clear all compiled view files

name: volt:install
description: Install all of the Volt resources
